meanings.definition: The quality or state of being covered in tar.
meanings.sent1: The road's tarriness made it difficult to walk on.
meanings.sent2: The tarriness of the roof showed it needed a new coat of paint.
meanings.sent3: The tarriness of the spilled tar made it look like a messy art project.
meanings.sent4: The tarriness of the situation stuck to them like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The tarriness of the substance left a lasting impression on the pavement.

meanings.definition: The act of applying tar to something.
meanings.sent1: His job involved the tarriness of sealing cracks in the road.
meanings.sent2: The tarriness of the construction crew's work was evident in the smell of tar.
meanings.sent3: The tarriness of the project made him feel like a modern-day tar artist.
meanings.sent4: The tarriness of the brush strokes created a unique pattern on the surface.
meanings.sent5: The tarriness of the task required precision and skill to avoid spills.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of having a sticky or thick consistency like tar.
meanings.sent1: The tarriness of the glue made it perfect for the job.
meanings.sent2: The cake's tarriness came from the rich chocolate frosting.
meanings.sent3: The tarriness of the mud made it hard for the shoes to come unstuck.
meanings.sent4: The tarriness of the situation clung to them like a stubborn stain.
meanings.sent5: The tarriness of the syrup made the pancakes extra delicious.
